prompt:
Sophia is a biologist with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on May 13), my wife (birthday on September 19), my child_1 (birthday on September 06), my father (birthday on July 27), my mother (birthday on June 05), 
2) Attending a fashion week in Paris in week 24-25.

3) Attend a parenting workshop every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 13.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Sophia for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

checks_range.24: Attending a fashion week in Paris
checks_range.25: Attending a fashion week in Paris

response:
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

#*# Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
The second week of the year was a whirlwind of activity, with the lab buzzing with the excitement of new projects. I spent most of my time in meetings, discussing the feasibility of our proposed designs with colleagues and stakeholders. The discussions were engaging and thought-provoking, pushing me to think creatively about the challenges we face in urban planning. Outside of work, the family and I continued our winter routine, taking long walks through the snow-covered streets and enjoying the crisp air. We also started a new tradition - a weekly family game night, where we gather around the table to play board games and share stories. The kids are enjoying this new ritual, and it's been a great way to bond and create memories. The weather remained cold, with temperatures dipping to -2°C on Wednesday, but we didn't let that stop us from enjoying the outdoors. We even managed to squeeze in a few hours of skiing on Saturday, which was a wonderful way to get some exercise and fresh air.

#*# Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
This week was a bit of a challenge, as the cold snap continued to grip the city. The temperatures plummeted to -5°C on Tuesday, making it difficult to venture out. However, we didn't let the cold weather dampen our spirits. We stayed indoors and focused on our personal projects. I spent some time reading up on the latest research in my field, while my wife worked on her art portfolio. The kids were busy with their schoolwork, but they also found time to create some amazing artwork, which they proudly displayed on the fridge. We also had a family movie night, where we watched a classic film together. The kids loved it, and it was a great way to spend quality time together. As for work, I made some progress on my design project, and I'm excited to see where it takes me. The lab is still buzzing with energy, and I'm looking forward to seeing the projects come to fruition.

#*# Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
The fourth week of the year was a bit of a mixed bag. The weather was still cold, but we managed to get out and about on the weekends. On Saturday, we went on a hike in the nearby woods, which was a great way to get some exercise and enjoy the winter scenery. The kids loved it, and we even spotted some deer along the way. However, on Monday, I had a bit of a setback at work. One of my colleagues left the lab, and I had to take on some of their responsibilities. It was a bit of a challenge, but I'm determined to rise to the occasion. I spent some time learning about their projects and meeting with their clients. It's been a steep learning curve, but I'm enjoying the challenge. At home, we continued our family game night tradition, and the kids are getting better at board games. They're also starting to show an interest in cooking, which is great to see.

#*# Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th): 
This week was a bit of a blur, as I was still getting used to my new responsibilities at work. However, I'm starting to feel more confident, and I'm enjoying the challenge. The lab is still buzzing with energy, and I'm excited to see the projects come to fruition. Outside of work, we had a family outing to the local museum, which was a great way to spend the day. The kids loved the exhibits, and we even managed to sneak in a visit to the gift shop. We also had a family dinner at a new restaurant, which was a great way to try some new cuisine. The kids were a bit hesitant at first, but they ended up enjoying it. As for the weather, it's finally starting to warm up, with temperatures rising to 10°C on Wednesday. It's a welcome change, and we're looking forward to spending more time outdoors.
